triana.types.audio

Class AudioChannelFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • triana.types.audio.AudioChannelFormat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, ChannelFormat

    public class AudioChannelFormat
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, ChannelFormat
    The AudioChannelFormat includes aspects of the sound format other than the number of channels. This class consists of the following parameters :

    1. sample rate : the sample rate, specified as an int
    2. sample size : the number of bits used to store each sample
    3. channel name : the name of this channel
    4. audio encoding : the audio encoding used e.g. PCM, U_LAW, GSM etc

    One ubiquitous type of audio encoding is pulse-code modulation (PCM), which is simply a linear (proportional) representation of the sound waveform. With PCM, the number stored in each sample is proportional to the instantaneous amplitude of the sound pressure at that point in time. The numbers are frequently signed or unsigned integers. Besides PCM, other encodings include mu-law and a-law, which are nonlinear mappings of the sound amplitude that are often used for recording speech.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form
